item.description:
An event for Minilympic teams only. Please do not RSVP unless you are registered in the Minilympics roster.

This event will be an elimination style tournament. Each round, player(s) with the lowest score will be eliminated until we have a winner or winners.

This event is worth 20 points for 1st place, 15 points for 2nd place and 10 points for 3rd place. All teams will receive 5 points for participating.

 

The Game: Relatively new to the scene, Dabble may not have been on the shelves long enough to be played by people in this group.  You can think of it as a word jumble with different point values for different words you assemble.  Tasked with competing both against yourself as well as others, this game can arguably capture the Olympic spirit for word game aficionados.

Tournament will run from 6pm to 10pm for 10 players.  If you wish to participate as a spectator, please say so in the comments and we will have room on a first come, first serve basis for 6 people.

 

*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***
Did you know? (A Tribute to Gaming around the World):

Parcheesi, the famous game of India, has a chauvinistic background.  It was originally played using real young women as game pawns and the Emperor's throne (and subsequently his lap) as Home.
*** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** *** ***

group.name: The Salem Board Games Meetup Group

item.name: Minilympics: Word Event: Dabble
